H0.text: Flatten due to the forces will occur when a ball dropped from the top of a tall building has the upward force of air resistance equal to the downward pull of gravity.

H1.text: The ball will fall at a constant speed when the upward force of air resistance equals the downward pull of gravity as it drops from the top of a tall building.

H2.text: Continue to speed up is what the ball will do when the upward force of air resistance becomes equal to the downward pull of gravity as it falls from the top of a tall building.

H3.text: Slow to a stop is what the ball will do when the upward force of air resistance becomes equal to the downward pull of gravity as it falls from the top of a tall building.

A4.text: At this point the object stops accelerating and continues falling at a constant speed called the terminal velocity.

A5.text: Since the net force on the object is zero, the object has zero acceleration.
